doc.title: Jefferies
doc.source_uri: 2025-08-29/Sustained Profit Profile ImprovementSustained Profit Profile Improvement_2025-08-29

passages.text: Sustained Profit Profile Improvement

Daifuku's being on track to deliver higher profit in FY25 than its forecast should enhance investor confidence in the improvement of mgmt execution. Upward revisions to the consensus profit estimates for FY26 would make the share price valuation more appealing. Quarterly volatility in orders would be unsurprising to us. We raise our price target.

**Continued** **market** **re-rating:** Daifuku's QoQ OPM increases in 2Q25 for warehouse automation and semiconductor fab automation business proved its project execution ability and pricing power. Mgmt's forecast of YoY OPM dips in 2H25 despite improving profitability of ongoing projects implies upside to FY25 OP guidance. Our order forecast suggests upward revisions to the consensus OP estimates for FY26 (FactSet: ¥96.9bn; our new forecast: ¥104bn; ¥94.5bn previously). We expect mgmt to raise its FY27 OP target (¥92bn; FactSet: ¥104bn; our new forecast: ¥117bn; ¥103bn previously) at FY25 results announcement. Accumulation of free cash flow in FY25 should incentivize mgmt to raise dividend or buy back shares, in our view.

**Intralogistics (IL):** 2Q25 OPM in the US was a record-high 20%, thanks to cost cuts, smooth construction work progress, and lower provision fees than its initial estimate. Mgmt forecasts US OPM of 13% for 2H25 and 15% for FY25. Mgmt expects increasing in-house production and is making efforts to raise contract price to ensure OPM uptrend in FY26. Mgmt aims for OPM of 20% in Japan in the future, from 18% in FY25 after redevelopment of domestic factory. E-commerce (EC) related projects will make up 10% of orders in Japan in FY25 vs just below 20% in FY24. This implies successful penetration into broader customer groups. EC projects make up 60% of the orders in the US in FY25, vs c.10% in FY24. Daifuku's dependency on the top EC provider is low.

**Cleanroom Automation (CR):** 2Q25 OPM reached a record-high 23%, driven by price hike,cost cut, and improving profit-margin of the ongoing fab projects in Taiwan. Daifuku is not involved in the Taiwanese semiconductor major's fab in the US due to low visibility for profitability improvement. CR's OPM in China may have reached up to 30% in FY24 (our estimate), followed by Taiwan and Korea. Korea's OPM will improve as Daifuku applies cost-cut measures it conducted in Taiwan to projects in Korea. We expect multiple fab plans by the local semiconductor industry*(Table 4) to support CR orders in China.

**Automotive Automation (AM):** OPM is set to increase in FY26 from 15% in FY25 and breakeven in FY3/22 via price hikes. Mgmt sees downside risks to AM orders as the auto industry stays cautious on additional capex.
**Airport Technologies (AP):** Daifuku sees positive business environment in the US. We expect improving execution at New Zealand and UK subsidiaries to lead to an OPM uptrend from now.
**PT:** Our new price target is ¥5,500 (from ¥4,600). This is based on EV/EBITDA of 15.7x, consistent standard deviation above the three-year average, and our FY26 EBITDA forecast (FY25 previously).
Please see analyst certifications, important disclosure information, and information regarding the status of non-US analysts on pages 8-13 of this report. * Jefferies (Japan) Limited
Equity ResearchAugust 29,2025

**Sho Fukuhara*|Equity Analyst**
**Shintaro Yoshida*|Equity Associate**

We believe Daifuku will continue to benefit from global demand for logistics equipment, driven by e- commerce projects. We believe the current medium- term OP target is based on management's conservatism mainly in semiconductor projects and incremental capex among domestic e- commerce operators. Recent demand environment in Japan and the US for warehouse automation projects and semiconductor related automation projects suggests sustained medium- term sales growth.
Risk/Reward - 12 Month View

Daifuku is the top warehouse automation equipment provider for the world's manufacturers and should benefit from rising demand for automation at logistics distribution centers. We believe Daifuku's established industry presence suggests management could have been conservative about its order forecast. Our base- case scenario price target of \(\) 5,500\(is based on an EV/EBITDA of 15.7x, one standard deviation above the average during FY3/22- 12/26 year - to - date, and our FY12/26 EBITDA forecast.

FY12/26 sales exceed our base- case forecast by \(15\%\) which leads to OP beating our base- case scenario forecast by \(21\%\) capex for automated production lines in general manufacturing industries ends up stronger than we expect; Daifuku sees further additional capex from semiconductor majors; Daifuku faces less pricing pressure from its key customers than we expect; Daifuku improves its overseas productivity at a faster pace than we expect; our bull- case scenario price target of \(\) 6,400\(is based on an EV/EBITDA of 15.7x and our bull- case FY12/26 EBITDA forecast (\) 135.164bn).

FY12/26 sales miss our base- case scenario forecast by \(17\%\) which leads to OP falling short of our base- case scenario forecast by \(34\%\) capex for automated production lines in general manufacturing industries is weaker than we expect; Daifuku sees cutback in capex from Korea semiconductor majors; Daifuku faces pricing pressure from its key customers; Daifuku sees delays in the pace of improvement in overseas productivity; our bear- case scenario price target of \(\) 4,000\(is based on an EV/EBITDA of 15.7x and our bear- case FY12/26 EBITDA forecast (\) 77.894bn).
Top Material Issue(s): 1) Expansion of environmentally friendly products and services 2) Establishment of stable procurement in the supply chain 3) Optimization of global production

Company Target(s): Reduce CO2 emission by more than 300,000 tons. 2) Achieve more than \(70\%\) sales weighting of environmentally friendly products. 3) Reduce CO2 emission by more than \(25\%\) by 2050 (vs 2018 level).
Qsto Mgmt: 1) What is the time horizon to achieve carbon neutrality? 2) How to secure profitability by continuing R&D for new products that meet ESG requirements?

Positive share- price catalysts are: 1) Daifuku's comment about potential upside in new orders vs company plan; 2) Daifuku delivers a higher Q3 FY25 OP than the consensus estimates; 3) e- commerce operators' announcement of boosting their capex plans over the near term. Negative catalysts include 1) Daifuku reports delays in its order- bookings; 2) Daifuku reveals any deterioration in the OPMs of major businesses.

Daifuku designs, manufactures, and sells material handling equipment such as automated storage systems, conveyors, and automatic sorters. The company's products are used for automation in manufacturing and distribution businesses.

Our price target of \(\yen 5,500\) is based on a EV/EBITDA of \(15.7x\) , one standard deviation above the average level during FY3/23- 26 year to date, and our FY12/26 EBITDA forecast. Downside risks include overall slowdown in semiconductor sector capex plans, deteriorating profitability in logistics projects, a setback in e- commerce operators' capex plans, and Korean competitors securing large- lot orders from semiconductor sector customers.
(Article 3(1)e) and Article 7 of MAR)
Recommendation Published Recommendation Distributed

Buy - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of \(15\%\) or more within a 12- month period. Hold - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of plus \(15\%\) or minus \(10\%\) within a 12- month period. Underperform - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of minus \(10\%\) or less within a 12- month period. The expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) for Buy rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(\) 10\(is 20\%\) or more within a 12- month period as these companies are typically more volatile than the overall stock market. For Hold rated securities with an average security price consistently below\) \ \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is plus or minus \(20\%\) within a 12- month period. For Underperform rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(\) 10\(, the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is minus\) 20\% \(or less within a 12- month period.
NR - The investment rating and price target have been temporarily suspended. Such suspensions are in compliance with applicable regulations and/or Jefferies policies.
CS - Coverage Suspended. Jefferies has suspended coverage of this company.
NC - Not covered. Jefferies does not cover this company.

Restricted - Describes issuers where, in conjunction with Jefferies engagement in certain transactions, company policy or applicable securities regulations prohibit certain types of communications, including investment recommendations.
Monitor - Describes securities whose company fundamentals and financials are being monitored, and for which no financial projections or opinions on the investment merits of the company are provided.

whether an investment decision made by the recipient based on this report is consistent with a recipient's investment objectives, portfolio holdings, strategy, financial situation, or needs.

By providing this report, neither JRS nor any other Jefferies entity accepts any authority, discretion, or control over the management of the recipient's assets. The price and value of the investments referred to herein and the income from them may fluctuate. This report may contain forward looking statements that may be affected by inaccurate assumptions or by known or unknown risks, uncertainties, and other important factors.
